alternative_parents.description: Polycyclic compounds that is either a polyphenolic compound composed of two or more monocyclic aromatic units linked by an ester bond (depside), or a compound containing the depsidone structure (depsidone).
alternative_parents.name: Depsides and depsidones

alternative_parents.description: Organic compounds that contain an ester derivative of 3,4,5-trihydroxybenzoic acid.
alternative_parents.name: Galloyl esters

alternative_parents.description: Aromatic compounds containing a benzoic acid, which is esterified with an alkyl group and para-substituted with a hydroxyl group.
alternative_parents.name: p-Hydroxybenzoic acid alkyl esters

alternative_parents.description: Benzoic acid esters where the benzene ring is meta-substituted with a hydroxy group.
alternative_parents.name: m-Hydroxybenzoic acid esters

alternative_parents.description: Aromatic compounds containing a benzene ring substituted by a hydroxyl group and an ester group.
alternative_parents.name: Phenol esters

alternative_parents.description: Aromatic compounds contaning a phenoxy group.
alternative_parents.name: Phenoxy compounds

alternative_parents.description: Organic compounds containing an acyl moiety of benzoic acid with the formula (C6H5CO-).
alternative_parents.name: Benzoyl derivatives

alternative_parents.description: Phenols that a unsubstituted at the 2-position.
alternative_parents.name: 1-hydroxy-2-unsubstituted benzenoids

alternative_parents.description: Phenols that are unsubstituted at the 4-position.
alternative_parents.name: 1-hydroxy-4-unsubstituted benzenoids

alternative_parents.description: Compounds containing an oxane (tetrahydropyran) ring, which is a six-member saturated aliphatic heterocycle with one oxygen atom and five carbon atoms.
alternative_parents.name: Oxanes

alternative_parents.description: Compounds containing one carbohydrate unit not glycosidically linked to another such unit, and no set of two or more glycosidically linked carbohydrate units. Monosaccharides have the general formula CnH2nOn.
alternative_parents.name: Monosaccharides

alternative_parents.description: Carboxylic acid derivatives in which the carbon atom from the carbonyl group is attached to an alkyl or an aryl moiety through an oxygen atom (forming an ester group).
alternative_parents.name: Carboxylic acid esters

alternative_parents.description: Organic compounds containing an heterocycle with at least one oxygen atom linked to a ring carbon.
alternative_parents.name: Oxacyclic compounds

alternative_parents.description: Compounds having the structure R2C(OR')2 ( R' not Hydrogen) and thus diethers of geminal diols. Originally, the term was confined to derivatives of aldehydes (one R = H), but it now applies equally to derivatives of ketones (neither R = H ). Mixed acetals have different R' groups.
alternative_parents.name: Acetals

alternative_parents.description: Organic compounds containing more than one hydroxyl groups.
alternative_parents.name: Polyols

alternative_parents.description: Organic compounds containing an oxide group.
alternative_parents.name: Organic oxides

alternative_parents.description: Derivatives of hydrocarbons obtained by substituting one or more carbon atoms by an heteroatom. They contain at least one carbon atom and heteroatom.
alternative_parents.name: Hydrocarbon derivatives

class.description: Naturally occurring polyphenols which be categorized into four main classes: hydrolyzable tannin (based on ellagic acid or gallic acid), condensed tannins (made of oligomeric or polymeric proanthocyanidins), complex tannins (made of a catechin bound to a gallotannin or elagitannin), and phlorotannins (oligomers of phloroglucinol).
class.name: Tannins

description: This compound belongs to the class of organic compounds known as hydrolyzable tannins. These are tannins with a structure characterized by either of the following models. In model 1, the structure contains galloyl units (in some cases, shikimic acid units) that are linked to diverse polyol carbohydrate-, catechin-, or triterpenoid units. In model 2, contains at least two galloyl units C-C coupled to each other, and do not contain a glycosidically linked catechin unit.

direct_parent.description: Tannins with a structure characterized by either of the following models. In model 1, the structure contains galloyl units (in some cases, shikimic acid units) are linked to diverse polyol carbohydrate-, catechin-, or triterpenoid units. In model 2, contains at least two galloyl units C-C coupled to each other, and do not contain a glycosidically linked catechin unit.
direct_parent.name: Hydrolyzable tannins

kingdom.description: Compounds that contain at least one carbon atom, excluding isocyanide/cyanide and their non-hydrocarbyl derivatives, thiophosgene, carbon diselenide, carbon monosulfide, carbon disulfide, carbon subsulfide, carbon monoxide, carbon dioxide, Carbon suboxide, and dicarbon monoxide.
kingdom.name: Organic compounds

subclass.description: Tannins with a structure characterized by either of the following models. In model 1, the structure contains galloyl units (in some cases, shikimic acid units) are linked to diverse polyol carbohydrate-, catechin-, or triterpenoid units. In model 2, contains at least two galloyl units C-C coupled to each other, and do not contain a glycosidically linked catechin unit.
subclass.name: Hydrolyzable tannins

superclass.description: Organic compounds that are synthesized either from the amino acid phenylalanine (phenylpropanoids) or the decarboxylative condensation of malonyl-CoA (polyketides). Phenylpropanoids are aromatic compounds based on the phenylpropane skeleton. Polyketides usually consist of alternating carbonyl and methylene groups (beta-polyketones), biogenetically derived from repeated condensation of acetyl coenzyme A (via malonyl coenzyme A), and usually the compounds derived from them by further condensations.
superclass.name: Phenylpropanoids and polyketides
